definitions.title: n.m.
definitions.body: twilight (prop. twilight-breeze, cf. [[לְרוּחַ הַיּוֹם]] Gn Ge 3:8; NH id.; Targum [[נְשֶׁף]], [[נִשְׁפָּא]];—´[[נ]] abs. 1 S 1Sa 30:17 +, [[נׇ֑שֶׁף]] Je 13:16; cstr. Is 21:4; sf. [[נִשְׁפּוֹ]] Job 3:9; —

evening twilight 2Ki 7:5, 2Ki 7:7 (cf. [[לַיְלָה]] v:2Ki 7:12); opp. [[בּׂקֶר]] Is 5:11; time of concealment Job 24:15, Pr 7:9 (+ [[עֶרֶב יוֹם]], [[אִישׁוֹן לַיְלָה וַאֲפֵלָה]], to emphasize sin that shuns the day); of refreshing Is 21:4 ([[חִשְׁקִי]] ´[[נ]]); of stumbling, in dim light Is 59:10 (opp. [[חָהֳרַיִם]]), so [[הָרֵי נׇ֑שֶׁף]] Je 13:16 (both fig.); [[כּוֹכְבֵי נִשְׁפּוֹ]] Job 3:9 the stars of its twilight (i.e. of night of Job's birth).—so [[וְעַד־הָעֶרֶב]] ´[[מֵהַנּ]] [[לְמָחֳרָתָם]] 1Sa 30 Klo Kit HPS (rd. [[לְהַחֲרִמָם]] for ´[[לְמָח]], We Kit Bu); Th, after Luth, sub so Buhl:Kex SS; Löhr allows either.
morning twilight Job 7:4 (opp. [[עֶרֶב]]). appar. also Ps 119:147.
